don't trigger an alert on that but only trigger an alert if it's something weird or something unexpected so metrics are

application and so you also want to focus on those smart high-level
thresholds and make sure that those are monitored and make life easy when you do

option to to monitor and use with lambda I think many of you may know that experience lambda that AWS automatically
retries for ace most asynchronously invoked lambda invocations and with
those retries you actually don't even care if there's an error or two so at the very least on those types of lambda
functions you should not monitor anything less than three errors not worried about the blips the function is
going to retry and your application is going to continue moving forward there could be some additional latency overall but if you if you really want to
do it right then the option is there to if there are several errors have a go to Adia a dead letter Q that can send to an
sqs queue and then you reprocess that later and then you only need to monitor that dead letter Q and if that size is
